Paper 1: Multispectral camera and a standard wide-aperture lens
Paper 2: IR image and point cloud from a TOF camera
2D image data and 3D point cloud data

Paper 1: Chromatic aberration and defocus blur for depth map recovery
Paper 2: Joint 2D-3D network incorporating image-based and point-based features for 3D human pose estimation

Paper 1: Real-world depth estimation in various scenes
Paper 2: 3D driver pose estimation in computer-human interaction scenarios

caption: Use of sensors and images for real-world estimation

decontext_schema.Type of sensor used: The Type of sensor used in the given table refers to the specific type of sensor or sensors employed in the research mentioned in each paper. In Paper 1, a multispectral camera and a standard wide-aperture lens are used. In Paper 2, an IR image and a point cloud from a Time-of-Flight (TOF) camera are used.
decontext_schema.Type of data used: The Type of data used in the table refers to the specific type of data that is being processed or analyzed in each research paper. For Paper 1, the Type of data used is multispectral images, and for Paper 2, it is 2D image data and 3D point cloud data.
decontext_schema.Method of real-world estimation: The Method of real-world estimation in the given table refers to the techniques used to estimate real-world measurements or quantities, such as depth maps or human pose, based on the data collected from the sensors mentioned in each paper.
decontext_schema.Applications of real-world estimation: The applications of real-world estimation refer to the practical use cases of real-world depth estimation or 3D human pose estimation in various scenes for Paper 1, and in computer-human interaction scenarios for Paper 2.
